name: Bahrain Personal Data Protection Law
description: Bahrain PDPL 30/2018, CBB AI Notice, and EDB AI Ethics Pledge compliance framework.

framework.name: Bahrain Personal Data Protection Law
framework.description: Framework for compliance with Bahrain PDPL 30/2018, Central Bank of Bahrain AI Notice (2023), and EDB AI Ethics Pledge

structure.title: Chapter 1: General Provisions
structure.description: Definitions, scope, and applicability of Bahrain PDPL 30/2018

items.title: Article 1 - Definitions
items.description: Key definitions including personal data, sensitive data, data controller, data processor, and consent under Bahrain PDPL
items.summary: Establish definitions for Bahrain data protection terms
questions: Are all personal data types identified per Bahrain PDPL?
evidence_examples: Data classification policy aligned with Bahrain PDPL

items.title: Article 2 - Territorial Scope
items.description: Law applies to processing within Bahrain and to Bahraini residents' data
questions: Is data processing within Bahrain documented?

items.title: Article 3 - Personal Data Protection Authority
items.description: The Ministry of Interior oversees data protection compliance

structure.title: Chapter 2: Data Processing Principles
structure.description: Core principles governing personal data processing under Bahrain PDPL

items.title: Article 4 - Lawfulness of Processing
items.description: Personal data must be processed based on lawful grounds including consent
items.summary: Ensure lawful basis for all processing
questions: Is lawful basis documented for each processing activity?
Are other lawful bases properly justified?

items.title: Article 5 - Purpose Limitation
items.description: Data must be collected for specified, explicit, and legitimate purposes
questions: Are purposes clearly defined and documented?
Is further processing compatible with original purpose?
Are purpose changes communicated to data subjects?

items.title: Article 6 - Data Minimization
items.description: Only collect data adequate, relevant, and necessary for the purpose
questions: Is data collection limited to necessity?

items.title: Article 7 - Accuracy
items.description: Personal data must be accurate and kept up to date
questions: Can data subjects update their data?

items.title: Article 8 - Storage Limitation
items.description: Data must not be kept longer than necessary for the purpose
questions: Is data deleted when no longer needed?

items.title: Article 9 - Security Measures
items.description: Appropriate technical and organizational security measures required

structure.title: Chapter 3: Data Subject Rights
structure.description: Rights granted to individuals under Bahrain PDPL

items.title: Article 10 - Right to Information
items.description: Data subjects must be informed about processing of their data
questions: Are privacy notices provided in Arabic and English?

items.title: Article 11 - Right of Access
items.description: Data subjects can request access to their personal data
questions: Are requests handled within legal timeframe?
Is data provided in accessible format?

items.title: Article 12 - Right to Rectification
items.description: Data subjects can correct inaccurate or incomplete data

items.title: Article 13 - Right to Erasure
items.description: Data subjects can request deletion of their data
questions: Is data deleted from all systems?

items.title: Article 14 - Right to Object
items.description: Data subjects can object to certain processing activities
questions: Is processing stopped when objection is valid?

structure.title: Chapter 4: Cross-Border Transfers
structure.description: Requirements for transferring data outside Bahrain

items.title: Article 15 - Transfer Conditions
items.description: Data transfers outside Bahrain require adequate protection

items.title: Article 16 - Adequate Jurisdictions
items.description: Transfers to jurisdictions with adequate protection levels
questions: Are transfers limited to adequate jurisdictions?

items.title: Article 17 - Contractual Safeguards
items.description: Use of contractual clauses for transfers to non-adequate jurisdictions

structure.title: Chapter 5: CBB AI Notice (2023)
structure.description: Central Bank of Bahrain requirements for AI use in financial services

items.title: Article 18 - CBB AI Registration
items.description: Financial institutions must register AI systems with CBB
items.summary: Register AI systems with Central Bank
questions: Are AI systems registered with CBB?
Is registration kept up to date?

items.title: Article 19 - AI Risk Assessment
items.description: AI systems in financial services require risk assessment
questions: Are AI risks identified and documented?

items.title: Article 20 - Model Governance
items.description: Governance requirements for AI/ML models in financial services
questions: Is model governance framework in place?

items.title: Article 21 - Consumer Protection
items.description: Protecting consumers from AI-related risks in financial services
questions: Are consumers informed of AI use?
Is human review available for AI decisions?

items.title: Article 22 - Open Banking AI Requirements
items.description: Specific requirements for AI in Open Banking services
items.summary: Comply with Open Banking AI rules
questions: Are Open Banking AI rules followed?

structure.title: Chapter 6: EDB AI Ethics Pledge
structure.description: Economic Development Board AI Ethics requirements

items.title: Article 23 - AI Ethics Commitment
items.description: Organizations should commit to AI ethics principles
questions: Is EDB AI Ethics Pledge signed?

items.title: Article 24 - AI Transparency
items.description: AI systems must be transparent and explainable
questions: Are users informed of AI involvement?

items.title: Article 25 - AI Fairness
items.description: AI systems must be fair and non-discriminatory

items.title: Article 26 - AI Accountability
items.description: Clear accountability for AI system outcomes

items.title: Article 27 - AI Safety and Security
items.description: AI systems must be safe and secure

items.title: Article 28 - Breach Notification
items.description: Data breaches must be notified to Authority and affected individuals
questions: Is breach detection capability in place?

items.title: Article 29 - Regulatory Audits
items.description: Authority may conduct compliance audits

items.title: Article 30 - Administrative Penalties
items.description: Violations may result in fines and sanctions under Bahrain PDPL

items.title: Article 31 - CBB Enforcement
items.description: Central Bank enforcement for financial sector AI violations
